thread.title: Manchester United dealt injury blow ahead of West Brom clash as Chris Smalling pulls out of England squad
thread.title_full: Manchester United dealt injury blow ahead of West Brom clash as Chris Smalling pulls out of England squad

author: Liam Corless
title: Manchester United dealt injury blow ahead of West Brom clash as Chris Smalling pulls out of England squad
text:
Manchester United dealt injury blow ahead of West Brom clash as Chris Smalling pulls out of England squad Smalling and Phil Jones have both returned to United this week following injuries sustained on international duty Share Chris Smalling is out of the England squad through injury (Photo: Shaun Botterill) Share Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Manchester United have been dealt a fresh injury blow after Chris Smalling withdrew from England's squad to face Lithuania through injury. 
The Red Devils are already set to be without Phil Jones for a month following an injury picked up earlier this week and now Smalling has added to Jose Mourinho's worries. 
United are likely go into next Saturday's game against West Brom with Eric Bailly and Marcos Rojo as their only recognised centre-backs. 
Jones is nursing a suspected broken toe suffered in training earlier this week and United fear he will miss all of their games in April, of which there could be as many as nine. Read More Phil Jones suffered a suspected broken toe in training earlier this week (Photo: Getty) Jose Mourinho won't be happy with how the international break has panned out (Photo: REUTERS) 
Middlesbrough defender Ben Gibson has been called up to the England squad for Sunday's Wembley qualifier while Gary Cahill has returned to Chelsea as he is suspended for the game against Lithuania. 
Gibson has been capped at Under-17, U18, U20 and U21 level for England but has never before been called up to the senior squad. Like us on Facebook
